title-group.article-title: EXPERIENCE WITH INCOME GENERATING ACTIVITIES FOR SOUTHERN AFRICAN WOMEN

abstract.p: Foreign donors are increasingly providing funds for income generating activities for African women. In the past, these funds have often been allocated through private voluntary organizations; currently more of the allocation is being undertaken by government ministries. What lessons have been learned that assure success of the enterprises, confidence building among women, and accelerated economic development? This article looks at the experiences in Botswana (with domestic funds) and Malawi and contributes observations and recommendations.
